docs.title: Welcome to Open Data Manager Documentation
docs.text: This documentation contains information how to use ODM system.

docs.title: Packages to install
docs.text: This section is about which packages you should install to use ODM.

docs.title: How to set up Genestack auxiliary scripts
docs.text: These scripts provide various auxiliary functions to simplify the work with Omics Data Manager.

docs.title: Start a console/terminal and install Genestack Auxiliary scripts:
docs.text:
# Install the latest version
python3 -m pip install \
      --extra-index-url https://public-nexus.devops.gs.team/repository/pypi-releases/simple \
      genestack-auxiliary-scripts

# OR: Install a specific version starting from 1.53.12, usually the same as ODM version, e.g. 1.54.0
python3 -m pip install \
      --extra-index-url https://public-nexus.devops.gs.team/repository/pypi-releases/simple \
      genestack-auxiliary-scripts==1.53.12

docs.title: To check the existing version, and view all available console commands, type:
You can always remove the package with a help of this command:
How to set up the Genestack Python client
docs.text: This article explains how to set up the Genestack Python client with a user and token, which then can be used by other scripts.

docs.title: Install the client and bind a user
docs.text:
1. Start a console/terminal and install Genestack Python client: 

    # Install the latest version
python3 -m pip install \
      --extra-index-url https://public-nexus.devops.gs.team/repository/pypi-releases/simple \
      genestack-client

# OR: Install a specific version starting from 1.53.12, usually the same as ODM version, e.g. 1.54.0
python3 -m pip install \
      --extra-index-url https://public-nexus.devops.gs.team/repository/pypi-releases/simple \
      genestack-client==1.53.12

  2. Obtain a token for your Genestack user by logging in to ODM and clicking on the profile link under the username. See an example for Public user below:

You need to click on the "Create new token" button, so you will receive an email with a link to your token. Please open the link in the email and save the token for future needs.

  1. Set up your account with the Genestack Python client from a console 

    genestack-user-setup -H https://domain_name/frontend

  2. Type ‘add’ to enter a new user, enter an alias for the user.

  3. Enter the host name, which should be of the format: https://domain_name/frontend.
  4. Then select authentication method by token (1) and input the content of the token you received in step 2: 
    1) by token
2) by email and password
Select authentication: 1
Host: https://domain_name/frontend
Please specify Genestack API token for "my_user":
  5. Type ‘quit' to exit the user-setup.

Users
docs.text:
This section is about users in ODM.

This is an admonition box without a title.

Syntax Description Test Text Header Title Here's this Paragraph Text And more

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3
  • pip
  • Genestack Python client installed and setup with a user account/token. See how to setup Genestack Python client
  • Auxiliary scripts installed. See how to install Genestack auxiliary scripts
  • A users.tsv file, for example: users.tsv

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Edit users.tsv file in the text editor and replace the example users with your own users - one line per user, detailing email and name, separated by a tab.
  2. Run the script below and follow its login instructions, replacing the host name with the address of the instance the script will apply:

$ odm-create-users -H localhost:8080\ or use the -u parameter and the user alias created when setting up the Genestack client

$ odm-create-users -u your_alias

  1. The script will create new users and print out their passwords, for example:
  alice@alphacorp.com    uNgp4F6C    Alice
  bob@alphacorp.com      xI3AOf2h    Bob
